problem.p: An astronaut is holding onto a long aluminum antenna attached to a deep-space probe which is floating freely far from any other object. The astronaut is initially at rest, but then begins to climb out along the antenna.

Which of the following statements accurately describes the linear momentum of the system containing the astronaut, antenna and space-probe during a time interval that starts when the astronaut is at rest and ends when the astronaut is in the process of climbing the antenna?

choicegroup.choice: The linear momentum of the astronaut, antenna and space-probe system is conserved.
The linear momentum of the astronaut, antenna and space-probe system is not conserved.
